lines.text:
[to Falfa]
Your car is uglier than I am!
[both John and Falfa look at her oddly]
Uh... that didn't come out right.
All right, all right, Bolander, break that up. You know the rules. You and your girlfriend want to do that, go someplace else, huh?
Hey, Kroot! Why don't you go kiss a duck?
What did you say?
I said, go kiss a duck, marblehead.
Okay, Bolander, you are suspended. Don't - don't you even come in on Monday. You're out, you're out!
Hey, hey, Kroot. I graduated last semester. Remember?
Oh, rats. I thought some of my friends might be here.
Probably a couple of weeks past their bedtime.
Oh, wait, there's Dee Dee. I hope she sees me.
Oh, shit. Dee Dee!
You're the most beautiful, exciting thing I've ever seen in my life and I don't know anything about you.

[John turns off the radio]
Why did you do that?
I don't like that surfin' shit. Rock and roll's been going down hill ever since Buddy Holly died.
Don't you think the Beach Boys are boss?
You would, you grungy little twirp.
Grungy? You big weenie! If I had a boyfriend, he'd pound you.
Yeah, sure.
Hey, man, who cut the cheese?
He who smelt it, dealt it.
Someone wants me. Someone roaming the streets, wants ME... Will you turn the corner?
What the hell's goin' on here, Toad? Hey, man, are you all right?
Yeah, I'll die soon, then it'll all be over, John.
Wow, you're just like the Lone Ranger.
Yeah, yeah. Listen, are you with him?
You're talking to the woman I love.
What happened, man?
Pardon me, sir, but I lost my I.D. in... in a flood and I'd like to get some Old Harper, hard stuff. Would you mind buying a bottle for me?
Why certainly! I lost my wife, too - her name wasn't Idy, though, and it wasn't in a flood - but I know what ya...
Thanks, here's enough for a pint.
Is that tuck and roll?
Yeah!
That's bitchin' tuck and roll! You know, I really love the feel of tuck and roll upholstery.
You do?
Yeah.
Yeah? Well, get in and I'll let you feel it... I mean, you know, you can touch it... uh... I'll let you feel the upholstery.
Okay.

[wearing sunglasses at night with two other members of the Pharoh's gang]
Whadaya doin' creep?
Who, me?
No, I'm talkin' to the other fifty creeps here. You know Gil Gonzales?
Gil Gonzales? No. No, I don't.
Don't know Gil huh? Well you oughta. He's a friend of ours and that's his car you got your butt parked on.
Hey! You got a bitchin' car.
Yeah, I know.
In fact, your car's so neat, we're gonna give you our special prize. You want me to give it to you?
Sweetheart, if the prize is you, I'm a ready teddy.
Well, get bent, turkey!
[throws a water balloon which misses him and hits Carol]
Hey man, I'm sorry if I scared ya!
You're gonna hafta do one hell of a lot more than that to scare me!
Hey, I've been lookin' all over for ya, man. Didn't nobody tell ya I was lookin' for ya?
Man, I can't keep track of all you punks runnin' 'round here backwards.
Hey you're s'posed to be the fastest thing in the Valley man, but that can't be your car, it must be your mama's car! I'm sorta' embarrassed to be this close to ya!
Yeah, well I'm not surprised, drivin' a field car!
Field car? What's a field car?
A field car runs through the fields, droppin' cow shit all over the place to make the lettuce grow.
Ha ha! That's pretty good! Say, I like the color of your car there, man. What's that s'posed to be? Sort of a cross between piss yella' and puke green, ain't it?
Well, you call that a paint job, but it's pretty ugly. I bet you got to sneak up on the pumps just to get a little air in your tires!
Well at least I don't have to pull over to the side just to let a funeral go by, man.
Oh ho, funny!

[to Terry]
Peel out, I just love it when guys peel out.
Hey Deb, How's my soft baby?
Come on, beat it, Vic. I'm not your baby.
Aw, come on honey. Look, so I never called you back. I've been, you know, busy.
Yeah, three weeks? Besides, it only took me one night to realize if brains were dynamite you couldn't blow your nose.
Look who's talking. Hey, who's the wimp you're hanging out with now? Einstein?
Tiger happens to be very intelligent, unlike you. I know everything your dirty little mind is thinking - it shows.
Hey now, buddy, look. The lady obviously doesn't want to have...
Look, creep. You want a knuckle sandwich?
Uh, no thanks. I'm waiting for a double Chucky Chuck.
Then keep your smart-ass mouth shut.
[pauses]
Hey, I'll call you some night Deb. Some night when I'm hard up.
I won't be home.
[lights a match and throws it at him as he makes an obscene gesture at her]
Get out of here.
You seem to know a lot of weird guys.
That creep's not a friend of mine, he's just... *horny*. That's why I like you, you're different.
I am? I mean, do you really think I'm intelligent?
Yeah, and I bet you're smart enough to get us some brew.
[she puts her arm around him, leans over and kisses him]
Yeah.
Brew?
Yeah.
You mean liquor. Yeah, yeah right, liquor. Yeah, this place is too crowded anyway.
[starts the car, backs up and pulls out of Mel's Drive-in]
Shit! Hey, get down!
Hey, is this what they call "copping a feel"?
What? No, get up, N-O. Sheezus.
What's your name?
My name? Mud, if anybody sees you.
Maybe if it's the goat killer, he'll get somebody and we'll see the whole thing.
I don't want to see the whole thing.
Stand by for justice!

[gleefully]
Rome wasn't burned in a night.
We're finally getting out of this turkey town, and now you wanna crawl back into your cell, right? You wanna end up like John? You just can't stay seventeen forever.
Joe College strikes out.
Girls don't pay - guys pay!

[waves for Curt to come over]
Get down! OK now, you got it? I'm staying here, you're on your own.
Wait a minute, wait a minute, Joe... wait a minute. What if he hears me?

Shhh. Listen, listen! Look at it this way. Now, you got three choices. One, you chicken out and in that case I let Ants tie you to the car and drag you around a little bit and you don't want that. Right?
No.
Two, you foul up and Holstein hears you and, well uh... you don't want that, right?
No, I don't.
Three, you are successful and you join the Pharaohs with a car coat and a blood initiation and all that, huh?
[Joe pats Curt on the shoulder and runs back to the car]
What? Wait a minute, wait a minute! What blood initiation?
Hey, you know a guy around here with a piss yellow deuce coupe, supposed to be hot stuff?
You mean John Milner?
[Falfa nods slowly]
Hey, nobody can beat him, man. He's got the fastest...

[cutting him off]
I ain't nobody, dork! Right?

[intimidated]
Uh... right.
Hey, you see this Milner, you tell him I'm lookin' for him, huh? Tell him I aim to blow his ass right off the road.
Hey, hey, hey, baby. What do you say?
Don't say anything and we'll get along just fine.
I thought you'd left.
No, not yet. I have no matches.
That's all right.
[strikes a match and lights his cigarette]
Brother, how do I get stuck with dance supervision? Will you tell me that? You going back east? Boy, I remember the day I went off. Got drunk as hell the night before, just...
Blotto.
Blotto, exactly. Barfed on the train all the next day, too.
Cute, very cute. Where'd you go again?
Middlebury, Vermont.
Right.
Got a scholarship.
Only stayed a semester?
One semester. After all that, I came back here.
Why did you come back?
I decided I wasn't the competitive type.
[pauses]
I don't know, maybe I was scared.
Well, I uh - I think I may find that I'm not the competitive type myself.
What do you mean?
Well, I'm not really sure that I'm
[pauses]
going.
Hey now, don't be stupid. Experience life! Have some fun, Curt! Anyway, good luck.

[to Terry]
Is that you in that beautiful car? Geez, what a waste of machinery!
Where are you going? It's awfully early in the morning.

[pause]
I have a dentist appointment.
Oh, no, not me. Not old Carol. The night is young and I'm not hittin' the rack till I get a little action.
[first lines]
Hey, what do you say, Curt? Last night in town... you guys gonna have a little bash before you leave?
The Moose have been looking for you all day.
[hands a check to Curt]
They got worried... thought you were trying to avoid them or something.
What is it? What do ya got?
Oh, great.
That's $2,000 man! Two thousand dollars!

Mr. Jennings gave it to me to give to you. He says he's sorry it's so late, but it's the first scholarship the Moose Lodge has given out. And he, uh, says they're all very proud of you back at the lodge.
Cute. Why don't you hold it for me for awhile?
Hey, I don't want it. Take it... it's yours.
I'll take it!
[last lines]
I know, uh... you probably think you're a big shot, goin' off like this...

[he slaps Curt]
... but you're still a punk.
OK, John... So long... So long!
[Steve, Terry, Laurie and John wish Curt goodbye]
Have a good trip!
Bye, Curt. Good-bye!
You're a regular J.D.
File that under uh, C.S. over there.
[hands her the ticket Holstein just issued him]
C.S.? What's that stand for?
Chicken shit - that's what it is.
Oh.
[puts the ticket in the glove compartment which is full of similar tickets]

[after Terry has backed into his car]
Excuse me, but I think we've had an accident.
Well, goddammit, I won't report you this time, but next time just watch it, will ya?
I thought, maybe before I leave, we could agree that... that seeing other people while I'm away can't possibly hurt, you know.
You mean dating other people?
I think it would strengthen our relationship. Then we'd know for sure that we're really in love. Not that there's any doubt.

[referring to Steve's car]
This is a super fine machine!

[to the mysterious blonde, driving off after mouthing "I love you" to him]
What did you say? Wait, what did you say?

[to a girl in a Studebaker]
If you ever get tired of going steady with somebody that ain't around, I'm up for grabs.

[to Laurie]
Why are you so depressed? You'll forget him in a week. After you're elected senior Queen, you'll have so many boys after your bod.

[to Carol]
Hey! Driving is a serious business. I ain't having no accidents just because of you!
So, your Judy's little... Shit! How old are you?
I'm old enough. How old are you?
I'm too old for you.
You can't be that old.

[to Debbie]
Hello. Buenos Noches. You sure you don't need a lift somewhere? Huh? Hey, you know John Milner? John Milner's a good friend of mine. Hey, did anybody ever tell you that you look just like Connie Stevens?

[to Steve]
I don't care if you leave this second!
Come on.
Come on, what?
Steven, please. Smile or something.
Quit pinching!
You think I care if you go off? You think I'm gonna crack up or something? Boy, are you conceited!
I don't know why I ever asked you out!
What's wrong?

[emotionally]
Go to hell!
A double Chubby-Chuck, a chili-barb, two orders of French fries and...
Let me have a Three Musketeers, and a ball point pen, and one of those combs there, a pint of Old Harper, a couple of flash light batteries and some beef jerky.
Okay, you got an I.D. for the liquor?
Oh, umm, yeah. Oh, nuts, I left it in the car.
Sorry. You'll have to get it before...
Well, I... I also... I forgot the car.
Hey, did you get it? Did you get it? Did you get it? Did you get it? You got it! You got it!
Sneakin' around with the Wolfman, baby. This is gonna strike a raw nerve, Mama. Here's The Platters.
You know Toby Juarez? Toby Juarez, he's a Pharaoh isn't he?
Toby Juarez? Sure, we know Toby. We killed him last night. Tied him to a car and dragged him.

[to Curt]
You better comes with us and take a ride with the Pharaohs, huh?
Let's dance.
I just love listening to Wolfman. My Mom won't let me at home. Because he's a Negro. I think he's terrific.
Rock 'n' Roll will stand man. Who's this on the Wolfman telephone?

[after being hit with a water balloon]
Very funny. What a chop! Ha-ha! Quit laughing! Let's catch 'em at the light. Jump out and flatten their tires.
Wait a minute.
Just do as I say!
Alright, boss.
Wow, it's a really beautiful night tonight. It's a perfect night for horseback riding.
Hey, what are you punks doing? What's going on here?
I'm just uh...
Oh, hi, Mr. Gordon. What's up?
I can't see what he's doing. Darn it, I wish I could see.
I can't see anything. I don't wanna see anything.
[Debbie walks away]
Just keep him away from me, that's all I want. How do I get into these things? We're all right up... Debbie? Debbie?

[to John]
Oh, race him. You can beat him.
Listen, I still gotta find that blonde.
Gee, thanks. It's just like a ring or something. It's like were going steady.
Get your bugaloos out baby! The Wolfman is everywhere.

[singing]
Some enchanted evening / You will see a stranger / You will see a stranger / Across a crowded room / And somehow you'll know / That she is the one...
Sicker 'n' a dog, that's for sure.
You know, what, Terry. I had a pretty good time tonight.

[to Curt]
Hey, have a popsicle. The ice box just broke down, and they're melting all over the place. You want one?

[to Curt]
Hey, what do you want? Push the red switch down.
Are you the Wolfman?
No, man. I'm not the Wolfman. Wait a minute.
[puts in a tape]
"Who is this on the Wolfman Telephone?".
"Diane".
"How you doing, Diane?".
That's the Wolfman.
Paradise Road.
He's a friend of mine, you hear? And little girl... you better call him, or the Wolfman gonna get you!
Are you guys ready?
Oh, that was beautiful, John. Just beautiful.
I was losing man.
What?
You'll always be Number One, John. You're the greatest.
Jesus, what a night!
Little kiss on your ear. Goodnight, sweetheart. I'll see you later.
I was a dirty bird, Carol's not grungey - she's bitchin'
Took the header plugs off, eh? Expectin' some action?
Yeah, I think so. There's some punk lookin' for me.
Why the hell do they bother? You've been number one as long as I can remember.
Yeah. Been a long time, ain't it? I'll see ya.
[John and Falfa arrive at Paradise Road for their drag race. John then suddenly notices that Laurie is with Falfa]
Hey, Laurie, what in hell are you doin' in there?
[to Falfa]
Is she gonna ride with you?
Mind your own business, John!
Yeah, she's goin' with me. You take care of yourself, man.

[quoting from Curt]
"It doesn't make sense to leave home to look for home, to give up a life to find a new life, to say goodbye to friends you love just to find new friends".
Hey, why don't we go get your jeep?
What? What are you talkin' about?
You know, your jeep, the one you sold the hunting horses for. The one with the four-wheel drive.
